name: Washoe County Golf Course
description: Washoe Golf Course is located within 10 minutes from the downtown Reno casinos and 5 minutes from Peppermill and Atlantis. It’s affordability, great practice facility, and full-service grill make it a perfect, convenient play for players of all levels.
designer: Original layout c. 1917, redesigned multiple times

faqs.question: What’s included in Washoe County golf group packages?
faqs.answer: Lodging, guaranteed tee times at Washoe County, carts, and concierge planning. Add transportation, dining, and multi-course options.

faqs.question: How much do Washoe County group packages cost?
faqs.answer: Typical range is $179–$399 per golfer depending on season, lodging, and group size.

faqs.question: Do you handle corporate or tournament groups?
faqs.answer: Yes—room blocks, tee-time blocks, tournament setup, and transportation for corporate and leisure groups.

Founded in 1917,
Washoe County Golf Course, affectionately known locally as “The Shoe”,
has a historical and storied past as colorful as Reno itself.
Originally opened as a members-only club, Washoe became public shortly after the depression.

Reno, NV
2601 S. Arlington Ave.
Reno, NV 89509
5 Minutes from Peppermill and Atlantis

tips.title: Golf The High Sierra
tips.content: Book your next group golf trip with us!

pointOfView: The Shoe has an absolutely throwback, old school quality to it that is hard to find in golf courses built after the 1970s. The course shows it age, but in the best way! Most of the course is flat, wide open and offers the opportunity to hit drivers on most holes, and take big cuts at them. But small greens, most distinctly remnants from it early designs, make approach shot accuracy and proper club selection paramount for scoring low. The ancient age and giant sizes of the course's elm, cottonwood, oak, and evergreen trees are impressive and in play continuously throughout your round.
contentParagraphs: Book Washoe County Golf Course in Reno with golf groups, tee times, and stay & play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and tournaments.

Founded in 1917, Washoe County Golf Course, affectionately known locally as “The Shoe”, has a historical and storied past as colorful as Reno itself. Originally opened as a members-only club, Washoe became public shortly after the depression.

This scenic venue hosted its first professional tournament in 1946 and boasts among its champions none other than the legendary Ben Hogan in the 1948 Reno Open Invitational. In the decades since, "The Shoe" has undergone many changes. But, to this day, it has held its own as one of the most beautiful, playable tracks in the Truckee Meadows, and remains a favorite for its club members, locals and visitors alike.

featuredHole.title: Hole #9 — Par 4
featuredHole.description: A classic municipal par 4 finishing hole with the Truckee River providing a scenic backdrop. The approach plays downhill to a green flanked by mature cottonwoods, making this one of Reno's most beloved closing holes for everyday players.

testimonials.quote: If you're planning a golf trip to Reno, NV, you have to play Washoe County Golf Course. We had 16 guys and GTHS handled all the logistics. Course was in fantastic shape and the practice facility was top-notch.
testimonials.author: Jennifer O.

testimonials.quote: Washoe County Golf Course delivers every time. This was our third trip and the course keeps getting better. Par 3s are memorable, greens are quick and true. Best value for championship golf in the Reno, NV area.
testimonials.author: Robert S.

testimonials.quote: First time playing Washoe County Golf Course and it exceeded every expectation. The scenery alone is worth the trip, but the course layout is genuinely challenging and fair. Our whole group wants to come back.
testimonials.author: Michelle T.
